0060/A0/07/884/006.headline: UNICEF continued to provide financial and technical support to the MoE  including high-level advocacy for Girls' Education and Early Learning.  The process of developing a national Girls' Education strategy/policy has been initiated and is in progress. 15 308 children (4-6 year olds  52% girls) benefitted from community-based pre-school education.

0060/A0/07/884/007.indicator_name: "d1. UNICEF-targeted children in humanitarian situations accessing formal or non-formal basic education (including pre-primary schools/early childhood learning spaces) - number & percent  see guidance"
0060/A0/07/884/007.headline: In 2017  UNICEF continued co-leading the EiE WG to respond to immediate education needs of over 700 000 children affected by the returnee/IDP crisis. UNICEF is targeting to reach 100 000 children. To date  25 000 returnee/IDP and host community children have access to education with essential information on their right to education.

0060/A0/07/884/001.status_value: 2 504 new CBEs established in 2016 + 2 676 existing CBEs supported (proxy)
0060/A0/07/884/001.indicator_name: Number of communities with less than 3 km walking distance to the nearest school
0060/A0/07/884/001.headline: UNICEF continued to provide support to the MoE in its efforts to reduce the overall number of 3.5 million Out of School Children (75% girls) across the country by providing increased access to education via formal  non-formal/alternative education opportunities (169 107 children reached through CBEs  3.5 million through TLMs).

0060/A0/07/884/001.status_value: 139 707 girls and boys reached through CBE  1.3 million students through TLM (proxy)
0060/A0/07/884/001.indicator_name: Out of school adolescent girls in the reporting year accessing formal or non-formal education with support of the UNICEF ECM programme

0060/A0/07/884/002.indicator_name: % of General Education (GE) department of MoE in focus provinces have the capacity to allocate resources and progressively manage the CBSs
0060/A0/07/884/002.headline: In 2017  UNICEF continued to provide technical and financial support to the MoE at national and provincial levels (19 PEDs) for better and more effective policy development  advocacy  coordination  planning  implementation and monitoring of OOSC/CBE related interventions.

0060/A0/07/884/002.indicator_name: % of national budget allocated for CBE

0060/A0/07/884/002.target_value: System for provincial budget in place

0060/A0/07/884/002.indicator_name: Number of children enrolling in grade 4 of hub school  previously completed CBE by sex

0060/A0/07/884/003.status_value: GPE Coordination Unit (GPCU) in place and functioning
0060/A0/07/884/003.indicator_name: Monitoring of the key milestones of an Inter-departmental coordination mechanism at MoE is strengthened and operational
0060/A0/07/884/003.headline: In the first half of 2017  UNICEF continued its role as Supervising Entity (SE) and provided technical and fiduciary support to the MoE in implementation of the GPE Programme. UNICEF leveraged US$5.2 million for the sector to continue the key activities of the programme and ensure smooth transition to EQRA.

0060/A0/07/884/003.status_value: M&E Framework developed and started to function at national and provincial levels
0060/A0/07/884/003.indicator_name: Monitoring of the key milestones of an M&E system for the GPE programme at MoE is functional at national and provincial and district level
0060/A0/07/884/003.headline: In the first half of 2017  UNICEF continued its role as Supervising Entity (SE) and provided technical and fiduciary support to the MoE in implementation of the GPE Programme. UNICEF leveraged US$5.2 million for the sector to continue the key activities of the programme and ensure smooth transition to EQRA.
